ssh provides no facility for non-interactive password but there are other options: 1) use a public key setup to authenticate instead of using a password.  2) fool ssh into querying a pty (pseudo-tty) and echo the password into that pty.  I'm not sure how to do the latter. There's a program (pty?) written specifically for hacks like that.  You could also use expect(1) for that.
